verse: When Abram was 99 years old, the Eternal One appeared to him again, assuring him of the promise of a child yet to come.
Abram bowed low, his face and body flat on the ground.

Then Abraham fell on his face and erupted into laughter in a moment of private absurdity, as he thought to himself, “Yeah, right! How can a centenarian father a child? Am I supposed to believe that Sarah, my 90-year-old wife, is going to have a baby?”
When God was finished talking with Abraham about all of this, He left and Abraham went home.

Abraham immediately took his son Ishmael and all of the slaves born in his household or bought with his money—every single male within his household—and circumcised the flesh of their foreskins on that very day, just as God had told him to do.
Abraham was already 99 years old when he was circumcised.
His son Ishmael was 13 years old when he received the mark of the covenant.
On the day Abraham and Ishmael were circumcised,
all men of the household, no matter where they had come from, were circumcised along with them.
